intro: Dicrastylis costelloi var. globulifera, commonly known as the globular star sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, globular inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring.
